channel.title: Making a new partition for windows xp from linux
channel.description:
Okay so I made a bootable copy of ubuntu from my flash drive ran gparted and changed the size of my ubuntu partition so that I would have 20 gb for windows. Now I formatted it to both ntfs and fat32 but when I run the installer for windows it says that there aren't any valid partitions. Any ideas?
[img]http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg190/scaled.php?server=190&filename=screenshotat20120204133.png&res=medium[/img]

item.title: Making a new partition for windows xp from linux
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“xI c E, post:7, topic:431772”][quote author=sp11k3t3ht3rd link=topic=534477.msg3907497#msg3907497 date=1328383567]
I tried it with ntfs too, it just happened to be fat32 when I took the screen shot. Also partition magic cost like $80…
[/quote]

I’m pretty sure there is a -free- way to get it. ;)[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Making a new partition for windows xp from linux

item.title: Making a new partition for windows xp from linux
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Windows XP needs empty space, not just a blank partition.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a new partition for windows xp from linux
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:431772”][quote author=t4 link=topic=534477.msg3907479#msg3907479 date=1328382520]

  1. NTFS is better for windows.
  2. when you do install windows, it will overwrite the linux bootloader (grub)
    [/quote]not necessarily you can use something like partition magic that is how I did it :o[/quote]
    my reply wasn’t directly answering OP’s question - it was some other advice.

Read full topic

[quote=“t4, post:3, topic:431772”]1) NTFS is better for windows.
2) when you do install windows, it will overwrite the linux bootloader (grub)[/quote]not necessarily you can use something like partition magic that is how I did it :o

item.title: Making a new partition for windows xp from linux
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4

@T41 wrote:

  1. NTFS is better for windows.
  2. when you do install windows, it will overwrite the linux bootloader (grub)
